result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Pursuant to the stipulation of the parties, the Court so ORDERS the defendant's
bond to be modified as follows:
The defendant shall not have any unsupervised contact with any minor children
other than incidental contact. The defendant's contact with E.H. or B.J.H. or M.R.H. shall be
supervised by J.L.F. or the defendant's father. Contact with E.H. or B.J.H. or M.R.H. shall be at the
sole discretion of J.L.F., and in a place or places of J.L.F.'s choosing. Defendant to have no violent
or disorderly contact with J.L.F. Contact with J.L.F. shall be limited to childcare and visitation
purposes. Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety: not to possess or consume any intoxicant or
controlled substance not prescribed to the defendant. Defendant not to possess any weapons.

records.addlTxt: 02:40 PM Derek James Holden, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Adam Thomas Witt. Matt Lantta appeared as prosecuting attorney. Defendant waived the right to a preliminary hearing on both cases 22CF8 & 22CF35. Information filed. Court advises defendant of charges & penalties. Defendant waives reading of complaint. The Court enters a plea of not guilty of the defendants behalf. Matter set over.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on March 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

09:30 AM Derek James Holden, defendant appeared in Court in person without counsel. Matt Lantta appeared as prosecuting attorney. DE hasn't turned paperwork in to the State Public Defender's Office, he isn't sure if they will be representing him. The court orders DE to go to State Public Defender's Office now and turn in his paperwork and return to court at 10:00 AM today. DE given address and phone number to State Public Defender's Office. Court resumes at 10:04 AM same appearnces. DE does not know if he qualifies yet for SPD. DE to go to treasurers office and get all information needed to turn into SPD.  DE referred to apply with Judge's office for Court Appointed Attorney if he doesn't qualify for SPD. The court advises DE he can obtain his own counsel or proceed with out an attorney as the court needs to move forward. Matter set over.  Status conference scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
